If Phillips is ushered towards the door by Leeds while his hometown club seeks a windfall, then the 26-year-old will have to consider very carefully his next move if he wants to protect a legacy heâ€™s cultivated at Elland Road as one of their own. Crossing the Pennines would tarnish that. Alan Smith made that move when Leeds were on the bones of their arse and they still havenâ€™t really forgiven him in West Yorkshire. Indeed, it was reported last year that Phillips has already decided not to risk it. So United might be wise not to chase a lost cause. Of all those reportedly interested in Phillips this summer, I am told West Ham and Aston Villa are the only clubs to make enquiries so far. WHUFC remain interested following their January offers and AVFC CEO Purslow is a longtime admirer of Kalvin. As of now, no contact from MUFC â€” Jonathan Shrager (@JonathanShrager) March 22, 2022   Ryan Gravenberch For Gravenberch remains a teenager but has already amassed almost 100 appearances for Ajax and 10 caps for Holland. By the end of the season, he will have played almost four full senior campaigns before his 20th birthday. According to his former youth coach with the Amsterdam club, the deep-lying midfielder is â€œa better version of Paul Pogbaâ€ with the physique of Frank Rijkaard. Gravenberchâ€™s career so far has been spent under the wing of Erik ten Hag. If United opt to name the Ajax coach as their new manager, then there would be sense in having him bring a player he knows better than anyone else can claim to. He would be half the price of Phillips and around a quarter of the cost Rice might be, which is important now. Against Unitedâ€™s last move for an Ajax midfielder was hardly a roaring success. Perhaps that is why Gravenberch is said to be lukewarm about the prospect of moving to Old Trafford, especially with Bayern Munich keen. Apparently, Gravenberch would prefer to hear first what the Bavarians have to say and the story goes that personal terms have already been agreed. All Bayern must do is find common ground with Ajax over a fee and their opening offer of Â£21million wasnâ€™t too far from achieving its purpose. United may well be wasting their time putting Gravenberch at the top of their list of targets if he really is edging closer to Bayern. Where would you rather go right now?  Amadou Haidara For Ralf Rangnick certainly thought United would suit Haidara since he recommended that the club move on the Mali international in January. They decided not to because, well, United. The interim manager knows Haidara well from his time at RB Leipzig. It was Rangnick who took him to Germany from Salzburg and Haidara established himself as an important player for Julian Nagelsmann, Marsch and now Domenico Tedesco. Haidara can screen but Rangnick wanted him because of his ability to press further up the pitch. We assume Unitedâ€™s new coach will want to play a similar style to that which Rangnick has struggled to implement with the current squad and Haidara would certainly improve those prospects. In contrast to Gravenberch and Phillips, the prospect of playing for United arouses Haidara. â€œMy dream club is Manchester United,â€ he said in 2019. Though plenty has happened since which may have prompted a rethink. Against Rangnickâ€™s opinion presumably hasnâ€™t been founded on Haidaraâ€™s stats. In the Bundesliga alone: 109 players have attempted more tackles; 195 have a higher tackle success rate than Haidaraâ€™s 22.6 per cent; 113 players have applied more pressures; and 27 have a higher pressure success rate. For comparison, Scott McTominayâ€™s tackle success percentage is 49.2 per cent and Fredâ€™s is 25.4 per cent, which is the worst in the United squad, but still better than Haidaraâ€™s.  Aurelien Tchouameni For United are just one of the clubs interested in Tchouameni. Apparently, so too are Chelsea, City and Liverpool. Plus other big hitters on the continent. But the 22-year-old reportedly has the Premier League in mind for when he leaves Monaco. Tchouameni was Ligue 1â€™s best young player last season and already has seven France caps to his name. So impressive has he been while standing in for Nâ€™Golo Kante, Pogba said: â€œWe wish him to play a lot more games and that I am always by his side.â€ There is almost no chance of the pair teaming up at Old Trafford, butTchouameni could pick up a lot quicker the instructions of a new manager than Pogba and his team-mates have shown they are able or willing to over the years. â€œIn his position, you need to be disciplined and organise others around you,â€ said then-Monaco coach Niko Kovac. â€œHe is always trying to learn and understand. He absorbs all the information we give to him.â€ Tchouameni wouldnâ€™t break the bank for United, with a reported asking price of Â£42million within the Red Devilsâ€™ budget this summer, even if they are tightening their belts. Against Technically and tactically, there is no reason United shouldnâ€™t go forTchouameni this summer. Heâ€™s within budget, young but gathering experience quick and only getting better. But, of course, United are not the only club keen on the 22-year-old. Given how United hate losing face, will they really be prepared to go up against the likes of City and Liverpool when their rivals can offer Champions League football when they most likely cannot? Thatâ€™s not to say they shouldnâ€™t move decisively overTchouameni â€“ just donâ€™t expect them to.

Content_title: Tuchel tells Chelsea to beat Man Utd to â‚¬80m star â€˜at all costsâ€™
Contents: Thomas Tuchel has urged Chelsea to beat Manchester United to the signing ofAurelien Tchouameni â€˜at all costsâ€™. Tchouameni has emerged as one of the finest young talents in European football in the last year, starring for Monaco and the France international team. READ MORE: 2020 vision: Every PL clubâ€™s best signing of the decade so far Paul Pogba played alongsideTchouameni in Franceâ€™s 2-1 win over Spain in the Nations League final in October, and hailed his â€œextraordinaryâ€ talent. Pogba said:â€œVery, very good. Heâ€™s not a boy, heâ€™s a man. â€œItâ€™s a pleasure to play next to him. He brings a lot of energy. A lot of energy, extraordinary technical and physical quality. â€œWe wish him to play a lot more games and that I am always by his side.â€ Despite Chelseaâ€™s strength in the two holding midfield roles, they have struggled with absnences in those positions this season, and with Nâ€™Golo Kante and Jorginho both now 30 years old, Tuchel wants fresh blood in the middle of the park. Conor Gallagher is expected to return from his loan at Crystal Palace to stake a claim for a place in the Chelsea team next season, but his form hasnâ€™t lessened their interest in Tchouameni. The 21-year-old â€“ valued by Monaco at â‚¬80million â€“ is also on Unitedâ€™s radar, with some reports suggesting the Red Devils are leading the race. But Marca (via football.london) claim Tuchel has singled outTchouameni as his number one target and heâ€™s told Chelsea to land him â€˜at all costsâ€™ this summer. In an interview with Lâ€™Equipe, Tchouameni has previously discussed his future, insisting that he does not let it distract him from his work with Monaco. â€œI remember I was in Paris, after the Nations League. I woke up and my phone had blown up,â€ he said. â€œMy father called me, we talked about everything and he told me that I was on the front page of Marca. I went on Twitter and saw for myself. â€œI told him it was cool, but what does it actually matter? It doesnâ€™t. The front page of Marca will not define me or allow me to perform well in matches. Itâ€™s not real life, but it is the media world, the football business. They talk about me today but tomorrow, theyâ€™ll be talking about another. â€œIn the dressing room, they put the cover up and laughedâ€™ â€˜Oh, youâ€™re leaving us already?â€™ Itâ€™s flattering, but I donâ€™t wake up in the morning thinking about it.â€

Content_title: Would this season be a success if Liverpool won one out of four from here?
Contents: The Mailbox ponders how Liverpoolâ€™s season will be viewed if they donâ€™t win any of the three remaining trophies they are going for this month. Get your views in to theeditor@football365.comâ€¦ What qualifies as Liverpool success? I think itâ€™s pretty crazy that Liverpool could finish the season as FA Cup finalists, champs league finalists, runner up in the league and winner of the league cup and pretty much every fan will think of it as a failed season. Myself included. By any other standard any two of those four achievements is a superb season for 99% of teams. Which I guess highlights just how high Klopp has raised our expectations now. I said after we drew with city that the title was gone. That was a must win game. My friends (also reds) said I was pessimistic and city would def drop points along the way and we would win every game. Winning every game for us at that point would mean a 14 game winning streak, one of the longest in club history. So far weâ€™ve done that. But pep just knows how to put giant runs together and looking at the calendar at the time I couldnâ€™t see any teams taking points off city. Still donâ€™t. 4 games left and itâ€™s looking ever more likely that the season will finish with city being one point above us and that game Vs city being a costly one (though really any game we dropped points is just as costly). But I genuinely believe (as objectively as I can) that we will win a cup treble this season. Regardless of who makes it to the final it will be a very tough game with either two teams who play fast attacking football and a high tempo pressure game filled with talented players or Liverpool against a team of dark arts masters who are older than the Bible with twice the staying power. Would other Liverpool fans be disappointed with a cup treble? I want to say no but I know in my heart of hearts that that premier League trophy is the one we really want. Iâ€™d swap the champs league for the premier League this year for sure. I shouldnâ€™t be disappointed, especially considering only a few years ago we almost ceased to exist. But I know that pang of regret will be there anywayâ€¦Lee  Eye on the ballIsaac, believe me, my eye is very much on the ball. I am making no assumptions about Liverpool winning their last 4 games. In fact in my mail on Sunday I said it was a real possibility that they wouldnâ€™t. I am very worried about the game against Tottenham, just as I was worried about the Newcastle game, worried about the Man United game, worried about the Everton game and worried about pretty much every other game Liverpool play. I do find the comment about the â€˜ridiculousâ€™ concern from Liverpool fans about where City could drop points slightly odd though. Isnâ€™t that what football fans do? Are Spurs, Arsenal, Leeds, Burnley, & Everton fans not scouring the fixtures list to see where points may be won and lost? Seriously, if youâ€™re not doing that are you even a real football fan?Mike, LFC, London   Everton relegation bad for Man City Not only would Evertonâ€™s relegation be bad for the city it would also be bad news for Manchester City. As it stands City only have the Manchester derby as the game where â€œform goes out of the windowâ€ but Liverpool have two, with the Merseyside derby and the rivalry with United. It is rare that Liverpool actually do the double over Everton (this season aside) and it is hard to imagine a promoted team taking points off them. With the margin between the two being so small, Evertonâ€™s relegation might make all the difference next season and (perish the thought) beyond.CDM  Departing manager bounce 29th of April â€“ Rangnick appointed Austria manager for next season. 2nd May, Man United play their first convincing game of Rangnickâ€™s tenure, displaying flair, composure, and effort. It turns out these players can play, and they can defend, and score goals too. Coincidence? Or motivation? And if you believe it was â€˜just Brentfordâ€™ consider that if United had played this way and won all the games we played against teams in the bottom half of the premiership we would have had 16 points more. Contrary to popular opinion, this team doesnâ€™t need surgery. It needs a spark.Ved Sen, MUFC.  Ralf finds the formula Man Utd finally played good football. Huge shout outs to Mata & Matic. All the others players have 100% and it showed. Is it a coincidence Man Utd plays good football without Maguire & Rashford? The former simply doesnâ€™t deserve to be in a top six team, the latter is a footballer turned book writer who canâ€™t be bothered to run on a football pitch. If only Ralf had found this formula earlier. CheersAshwin â€“ Man Utd fan  Where did all the nicknames go? Two things which have been rolling around in my head recently â€“ What ever happened to nicknames for players? It feels like they are not as prominent anymore. In the past, here in sunny and loadshedded South Africa, we had wonderful nicknames for players like Ace, Computer, and my favourite, Lucas â€˜Masterpiecesâ€™ Moripe. According to Wikipedia, Steven Gerrard is referred to as the â€˜Hammer of Huytonâ€™. I canâ€™t recall ever singing for the â€˜Hammerâ€™. â€˜Scores from forty yardsâ€™, uncountable times. Was he referred to as the Hammer at all up in England? I know Luis Suarez went by â€˜El pistoleroâ€™ but this seemed to be more widely used for him in Uruguay? Maybe Salahâ€™s â€˜Egyptian Kingâ€™ moniker might currently be applicable but in truth, are nicknames still assigned? Iâ€™d love if we could start calling them James â€˜the Anvilâ€™ Milner and Joel â€˜Pureclassâ€™ Matip. My second mental wandering I confine to brackets. Best,Wik, Pretoria (MCFC double odds > LFC quad odds, donâ€™t we need more media pressure on Pepâ€™s men?), LFC  Not Bad That Michael Jackson gag in Winners And Losersâ€¦Iâ€™ll allow it. Just.Jon, Lincoln

Content_title: Liverpool target Tchouameni as well as teen duo as â€˜freshening upâ€™ set to continue under Klopp
Contents: Liverpool are set to continue to â€˜freshen upâ€™ their squad this summer and have set their sights on Monaco midfielderAurelien Tchouameni. Tchouameni is on the wishlists of a number of top European clubs, including Manchester United and Chelsea, but Liverpool have also entered the fray. MAILBOX: If Mo Salah was white he would get twice as many fouls. And other opinionsâ€¦ The 22-year-old midfielder has been a stalwart for Monaco since his Â£16m move from Bordeaux in the summer of 2020. The Times claim â€˜the clever recruitment of the likes of Luis DÃ­az, Diogo Jota and Ibrahima KonatÃ© in recent transfer windows has maintained the clubâ€™s forward momentum by freshening up the squad and that approach is likely to continueâ€™. The report continues, â€˜they like Monacoâ€™s AurÃ©lien TchouamÃ©ni, although they are aware the France international is attracting interest from Real Madrid. Whether they press ahead with interest depends on a number of factors, including price, but it would be a midfielder with a similar profile to the powerful TchouamÃ©ni that they would target should he be out of reachâ€™. Itâ€™s also claimed that the club is interested inAberdeenâ€™s 18-year-old right back Calvin Ramsay, who is also wanted by Leeds United, while a deal forFulhamâ€™s Fabio Carvalho, 19, has already been lined up. Liverpoolâ€™s desire to continue to improve the squad has been boosted by â€˜positive noisesâ€™ from Jurgen Klopp over signing a new deal at the club. President of Fenway Sports Group (FSG), Mike Gordon, flew to Liverpool on Wednesday for the Redsâ€™ Champions league semi-final clash with Villarreal with his ulterior motive to sit down with Klopp to discuss an extension. With Liverpool still on course to complete an unprecedented quadruple this season, FSG are understandably keen to tie Klopp â€“ whom they have always seen as the perfect manager for the club â€“ down to a new deal. The report claims â€˜the strong bond Klopp has forged with Liverpool from an ownership, player and supporter perspective underpins his contentmentâ€™. But adds â€˜afinal decision from Klopp on his future will also be heavily influenced by whether the assistant managers Pepijn Lijnders and Peter Krawietz are also on board, given the strength of his relationship with themâ€™.

Content_title: Liverpool â€˜initiate contactâ€™ with club over Â£50m-rated star â€˜interestedâ€™ in PL
Contents: According to reports, Liverpool have â€˜initiated contactâ€™ with Monaco over the signing of their Â£50m-rated midfielderAurelien Tchouameni. The Frenchman has also been linked with a move to Manchester United. It is said that Monacoâ€™s asking price â€˜could go up to Â£50mâ€™. Following a spell at Bordeaux, Tchouameni made the move to Monaco during the winter transfer window in 2020. Aston Villa and Steven Gerrard are on the wrong trajectory together The 22-year-old has been an ever-present for Monaco over the past two seasons. He has been in fine form as he has played 47 times this term across all competitions. Tchouameni made his senior debut for France last year and he has now been capped eight times. Foot Mercato journalist Santi Aouna has revealed (via Twitter) that Liverpool are targeting Tchouameni. It is said that â€˜contacts have been initiatedâ€™ between Liverpool and Monaco. In a boost to Liverpool, the player is reportedly â€˜interested in the ideaâ€™ of playing in the Premier League. Meanwhile, Michael Owen has been taken aback by the recent performances of Divock Origi: â€œIf you are in a rhythm, the easy bit is coming on and making an impact as a sub,â€ Owen said. â€œEveryone is tiring and itâ€™s a free punch, thatâ€™s the easy bit. â€œThe hard bit is the never playing bit. You get out of rhythm. Your mindset is not playing. â€œYou go to bed on a Friday and you donâ€™t even expect to play. â€œIf you keep doing the right things, keep eating the right food, go to bed at the right time, and training perfectly. And you keep getting disappointed every weekend, then something switches off, at some point. â€œFor him to stay at that level and that sharpness, and every single time he is called upon he comes on and makes a difference is quite staggering. â€œHe doesnâ€™t lose his fitness, his sharpness, he doesnâ€™t lose anything, appetite and his attitude. â€œIf I kept coming on and scoring, and being brushed aside and not starting and not playing, Iâ€™d start to get sickened by it. â€œSo fair play to him, [heâ€™s got] a great attitude.â€

Content_title: Ten Hag wants French midfielder to kick off Man Utd â€˜masterplanâ€™
Contents: Erik Ten Hag, who is on the verge of being appointed Manchester United manager, is hoping a French midfielder can start his Old Trafford â€˜masterplanâ€™. The Ajax boss has reportedly agreed terms in principle with United but is yet to be officially announced as their next permanent manager. Gossip: Manchester United linked with Premier League trio It is thought that confirmation of Ten Hagâ€™s decision to swap the Eredivisie for the Premier League will come after the upcoming Dutch Cup final this weekend, which will see his side face PSV Eindhoven. With the 52-year-oldâ€™s arrival looking imminent, a number of stars have been linked with the club as they look to rebuild on what has been another disappointing season. United have made it five consecutive seasons without a trophy after a campaign of turmoil on and off the pitch and could miss out on qualification for the Champions League next season. Arsenal and Spurs are currently ahead of the Red Devils in the race for the top four. Whether the prospect of no Champions League football next season will affect who the club will target this summer, it remains to be seen. However, that wont stop a number of players from around the globe from being linked with a move to Manchester. ESPN are reporting that the latest name to be on the Man Utd shortlist is Monaco midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni. The Frenchman, who has already made eight appearances for the senior national side at the age of 22, has been in fine form in Ligue 1 this season. His performances have drawn attention from a number of top sides around Europe, including Liverpool, Chelsea and Juventus. The 22-year-old now appears to be on the shortlist for manager-to-be Ten Hag as he looks to improve what has been a troublesome position for a number of years at Old Trafford. This season Scott McTominay, Fred, Nemanja Matic and Paul Pogba have all vied for a starting role in initially Ole Gunnar Solskjaerâ€™s side and, more recently, under Ralf Rangnick. Tchouameniâ€™s international teammates Pogba is out-of-contract in the summer and doesnâ€™t look likely to agree a new deal whilst Matic, at 33, is hardly a long-term solution. Scotland international McTominay and Brazilian Fred have improved this season but if United are to take the next step and begin challenging for titles again, they will need reinforcements and Monacoâ€™s Tchouameni could be brought in to do just that. It is also worth mentioning that Donny van de Beek, who is currently on loan at Everton, could feature more prominently next season after working under Ten Hag at Ajax.

Content_title: Man Utdâ€™s five midfield targets: the cases for and against
Contents: Manchester Unitedâ€™s priority for the summer transfer window is said to be a central midfielder. But which one? Here are some of the arguments for and against five of the most often linked targetsâ€¦ Declan Rice For The England international has proved himself to be just the man United need to anchor their midfield. Rice initially carved out a reputation as a screener and this season has shown his credentials as a box-to-boxer. Rice has made more interceptions than anyone in the top flight and only Brentfordâ€™s Christian Norgaard has made more combined tackles and interceptions than the 23-year-oldâ€™s total of 147. There seems very little risk with Rice. United know exactly what they would be getting and that certainty usually comes at a premium. About thatâ€¦ Against United will have to break their transfer record and almost certainly the Premier Leagueâ€™s for most expensive signing if they want to get Rice out of West Ham. The player would almost certainly like to take the next step (assuming itâ€™s not a lateral move between West Ham and United come the end of the season) and the Irons, under no pressure to offload with Rice under contract until 2025, could sell a huge deal to their fanbase. But that would require United to cough up in excess of Â£100million. Would they do that, especially if they arenâ€™t in the Champions League next season? United might find themselves shopping with a tighter budget.   Kalvin Phillips For If United canâ€™t get Rice, perhaps they might opt for his mate in Englandâ€™s midfield. Phillipsâ€™ quality has been emphasised by how badly heâ€™s been missed by Leeds during his recent injury-enforced absence. Heâ€™s not the only player Marcelo Bielsa and Jesse Marsch have been without, but Phillips seems like the biggest miss, especially given the way opponents have played through the Leeds midfield when heâ€™s not manning the engine room. Even if Leeds appear to be on a firmer footing in the Premier League after two dramatic wins last week, the Whitesâ€™ finances could make them susceptible to offers on Phillips. Reports suggest he could go for Â£60million, which may be around half the price of Rice. Against A few clubs are said to be keen on Phillips, with Liverpool, Man City, Newcastle and Aston Villa all credited with an interest. Indeed, Villa are reported to be leading the race. If Phillips is ushered towards the door by Leeds while his hometown club seeks a windfall, then the 26-year-old will have to consider very carefully his next move if he wants to protect a legacy heâ€™s cultivated at Elland Road as one of their own. Crossing the Pennines would tarnish that. Alan Smith made that move when Leeds were on the bones of their arse and they still havenâ€™t really forgiven him in West Yorkshire. Indeed, it was reported last year that Phillips has already decided not to risk it. So United might be wise not to chase a lost cause. Of all those reportedly interested in Phillips this summer, I am told West Ham and Aston Villa are the only clubs to make enquiries so far. WHUFC remain interested following their January offers and AVFC CEO Purslow is a longtime admirer of Kalvin. As of now, no contact from MUFC â€” Jonathan Shrager (@JonathanShrager) March 22, 2022   Ryan Gravenberch For Gravenberch remains a teenager but has already amassed almost 100 appearances for Ajax and 10 caps for Holland. By the end of the season, he will have played almost four full senior campaigns before his 20th birthday. According to his former youth coach with the Amsterdam club, the deep-lying midfielder is â€œa better version of Paul Pogbaâ€ with the physique of Frank Rijkaard. Gravenberchâ€™s career so far has been spent under the wing of Erik ten Hag. If United opt to name the Ajax coach as their new manager, then there would be sense in having him bring a player he knows better than anyone else can claim to. He would be half the price of Phillips and around a quarter of the cost Rice might be, which is important now. Against Unitedâ€™s last move for an Ajax midfielder was hardly a roaring success. Perhaps that is why Gravenberch is said to be lukewarm about the prospect of moving to Old Trafford, especially with Bayern Munich keen. Apparently, Gravenberch would prefer to hear first what the Bavarians have to say and the story goes that personal terms have already been agreed. All Bayern must do is find common ground with Ajax over a fee and their opening offer of Â£21million wasnâ€™t too far from achieving its purpose. United may well be wasting their time putting Gravenberch at the top of their list of targets if he really is edging closer to Bayern. Where would you rather go right now?  Amadou Haidara For Ralf Rangnick certainly thought United would suit Haidara since he recommended that the club move on the Mali international in January. They decided not to because, well, United. The interim manager knows Haidara well from his time at RB Leipzig. It was Rangnick who took him to Germany from Salzburg and Haidara established himself as an important player for Julian Nagelsmann, Marsch and now Domenico Tedesco. Haidara can screen but Rangnick wanted him because of his ability to press further up the pitch. We assume Unitedâ€™s new coach will want to play a similar style to that which Rangnick has struggled to implement with the current squad and Haidara would certainly improve those prospects. In contrast to Gravenberch and Phillips, the prospect of playing for United arouses Haidara. â€œMy dream club is Manchester United,â€ he said in 2019. Though plenty has happened since which may have prompted a rethink. Against Rangnickâ€™s opinion presumably hasnâ€™t been founded on Haidaraâ€™s stats. In the Bundesliga alone: 109 players have attempted more tackles; 195 have a higher tackle success rate than Haidaraâ€™s 22.6 per cent; 113 players have applied more pressures; and 27 have a higher pressure success rate. For comparison, Scott McTominayâ€™s tackle success percentage is 49.2 per cent and Fredâ€™s is 25.4 per cent, which is the worst in the United squad, but still better than Haidaraâ€™s.  Aurelien Tchouameni For United are just one of the clubs interested in Tchouameni. Apparently, so too are Chelsea, City and Liverpool. Plus other big hitters on the continent. But the 22-year-old reportedly has the Premier League in mind for when he leaves Monaco. Tchouameni was Ligue 1â€™s best young player last season and already has seven France caps to his name. So impressive has he been while standing in for Nâ€™Golo Kante, Pogba said: â€œWe wish him to play a lot more games and that I am always by his side.â€ There is almost no chance of the pair teaming up at Old Trafford, butTchouameni could pick up a lot quicker the instructions of a new manager than Pogba and his team-mates have shown they are able or willing to over the years. â€œIn his position, you need to be disciplined and organise others around you,â€ said then-Monaco coach Niko Kovac. â€œHe is always trying to learn and understand. He absorbs all the information we give to him.â€ Tchouameni wouldnâ€™t break the bank for United, with a reported asking price of Â£42million within the Red Devilsâ€™ budget this summer, even if they are tightening their belts. Against Technically and tactically, there is no reason United shouldnâ€™t go forTchouameni this summer. Heâ€™s within budget, young but gathering experience quick and only getting better. But, of course, United are not the only club keen on the 22-year-old. Given how United hate losing face, will they really be prepared to go up against the likes of City and Liverpool when their rivals can offer Champions League football when they most likely cannot? Thatâ€™s not to say they shouldnâ€™t move decisively overTchouameni â€“ just donâ€™t expect them to.

Content_title: Liverpool â€˜placed in the leadâ€™ with two other clubs for midfield target
Contents: Liverpool are in the lead to sign Monaco midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni in the summer transfer window, according to reports. Tchouameni was named Ligue 1â€™s Young Player of the Year last season after a breakout campaign which saw him start all but two of Monacoâ€™s league games. The 22-year-oldâ€™s accomplished displays as a deep-lying midfielder caught the eye of clubs such as Chelsea, Man Utd and Real Madrid, all of whom retained their interest going into the January transfer window. The financial insanity must stop; football needs recalibration A report last month insisted that Liverpoolare now â€˜more interestedâ€™ in Tchouameni than AC Milan midfielder Franck Kessieas they look to boost their engine room in the summer transfer window. Over the weekend it was claimed thatLiverpool and Man United â€˜have askedâ€™ about the France internationalâ€™s availability and Tchouameni â€˜would not see the option [of a Premier League move] badlyâ€™. And now Spanish publication Marca (via Sport Witness) reckon that Liverpool are now â€˜placed in the leadâ€™ for Tchouameni along with rivals Manchester United and Manchester City. Meanwhile, Liverpool beat Nottingham Forest 1-0 on Sunday as they moved into the semi-finals of the FA Cup with Jurgen Kloppâ€™s men excelling in all competitions. Diogo Jotaâ€™s 78th-minute goal secured a first win at Nottingham Forestâ€™s City ground in 13 visits â€“ succeeding where Arsenal and Leicester had failed this season â€“ to book a Wembley date with Manchester City on April 16. Getting past Forest, in the first meeting between the two clubs in 23 years, proved difficult enough. Had Philip Zinckernagel not missed a one-on-one with goalkeeper Alisson Becker a couple of minutes before Jota struck the outcome could have been different. â€œIt was the game we expected, especially if you donâ€™t use your chances,â€ Klopp said. â€œWe could have played better, but we should have scored in the first half. If we scored earlier it would be a completely different game. â€œAll respect to Steve (Cooper) and Nottingham Forest, a top, top performance, really professional, really well organised. â€œâ€œIt was a brilliant atmosphere. Everything was prepared to give us a knock as well but because we were prepared for a fight we came through.â€

Content_title: Liverpool, Man Utd â€˜have askedâ€™ Monaco about France international
Contents: Liverpool and Manchester United are both keen on bringingMonaco midfielder Aurelien Tchouameni to the Premier League in the summer transfer window, according to reports. Tchouameni was named Ligue 1â€™s Young Player of the Year last season after a breakout campaign which saw him start all but two of Monacoâ€™s league games. The 22-year-oldâ€™s accomplished displays as a deep-lying midfielder caught the eye of clubs such as Chelsea, Man Utd and Real Madrid, all of whom retained their interest going into the January transfer window. The Premier League will be dead when Klopp leaves Liverpoolâ€¦ A report last month insisted that Liverpoolare now â€˜more interestedâ€™ in Tchouameni than AC Milan midfielder Franck Kessieas they look to boost their engine room in the summer transfer window. And now Marca claims that Liverpool and Man United â€˜have askedâ€™ about the France internationalâ€™s availability and Tchouameni â€˜would not see the option [of a Premier League move] badlyâ€™. It is understood that Juventus are another team interested in the midfielder but thatTchouameni would not be willing to move to Serie A at this point in his career. The big rivals to the two Premier League sides comes from Spain, though, with La Liga giants Real Madrid eyeing upTchouameni as a replacement for Casemiro. He has been the subject of a number of â€˜juicy offersâ€™ already with the 22-year-old â€˜aiming for the Premier Leagueâ€™. Meanwhile, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp knows Andy Robertson is â€œdesperate to deliverâ€ as the left-back was landed with even greater responsibility in the wake of Trent Alexander-Arnoldâ€™s absence. With the Redsâ€™ marauding right-back, who has provided two goals and a career-best 16 assists this season, sidelined for a number of weeks with a hamstring injury, the emphasis will switch heavily to the Scotland captain on the opposite flank. While he has not been as prolific as his counterpart he was man of the match in Wednesdayâ€™s defeat of Arsenal, setting up the important second goal for Roberto Firmino. â€œIt is the full package of Robbo, not only as a player but a person as well. He wants desperately to deliver and work for the team,â€ said Klopp on Friday. â€œEven though he and Trent set up a lot of goals, there is still space for improvement in the decisive moments. â€œThe goal (at Arsenal) was one of our favourite goals for a long time; first we win the ball back and second Robbo is waiting with his cross until he saw Bobby is now ready for it. â€œIt was an incredible pass in the end and Bobby had to do a lot to get it past (Aaron) Ramsdale. â€œYes played a really good game. It is not the first one and I hope it is not the last one.â€

Content_title: Crouch struggling to choose between Liverpool and Man City stars for PFA Player of the Year
Contents: Peter Crouch thinks itâ€™s between Liverpool forward Mo Salah and Manchester City midfielder Phil Foden for thePFA Player of the Year at the end of this season. Salah, who will have a year left on his contract at the end of this campaign, has contributed 22 goals and 13 assists in 31 Premier League appearances this season as Liverpool attempt to chase City down in the hunt for another Premier League title. England international Foden has also been in top form for the Citizens with the 21-year-old scoring eight goals and providing his team-mates with five assists. Liverpool fans are the luckiest in the world, bad for city if Everton go down andâ€¦ And Crouch claims he is struggling to pick between the two of them for the end of seasonPFA Player of the Year award. Crouch wrote in the Daily Mail: â€œNow I like being on the right side of history, so I donâ€™t think itâ€™s particularly wise to pick a Player of the Year before we know who has won what. â€œIâ€™m often left surprised by how early they are generally done. The winner has to come from the best team and the best team is often unknown until May. â€œAll the awards should be left as late as possible and I always thought voting for the PFA Player of the Year was done far too early, often months before the season finishes. â€œIt seemed strange timing to me, with so much of the league left to play, and I could never quite get my head around why voting was not electronic either. There should be an app for your phone that takes 10 seconds to complete. More players might vote then, too! â€œThis year, if Manchester City win the Premier League and Champions League, you would have to pick Phil Foden or Kevin De Bruyne. Iâ€™d potentially go for Foden because he has consistently been a shining light for them. â€œThere are plenty of others you could choose and the same goes for Liverpool. The performances of Virgil van Dijk have been an absolute joke. Sadio Mane as well, coming back from winning the Africa Cup of Nations with Senegal and picking up where he left off. He has to be in the conversation. â€œI do seem to be skirting around the fact that Mo Salah â€” already crowned FWA Footballer of the Year â€” has the most goals and assists this season. Clearly he has to be in there, given how electric he has been throughout the campaign, even allowing for him going off the boil slightly in recent weeks. â€œThose five names are my list and it has to be one of them. If the two clubs trade trophies, Salah pips the others in my view for his sheer weight of goal contributions.â€

Content_title: Keane snubs Scholes, Ferdinand and Cantona in his greatest Man Utd Prem XI
Contents: Roy Keane left out a number of big names, including Paul Scholes, Rio Ferdinand and Eric Cantona, from his greatest Man Utd XI of the Premier League era. The former Republic of Ireland international played 480 times for the Red Devils over 13 seasons, winning seven Premier League titles, four FA Cups and a Champions League. He played alongside a number of amazing players during his time at Old Trafford and Sky Sports asked him to pick hisgreatest Man Utd XI of the Premier League era on their Monday Night Football show. Manchester United are shuffling their pack, but can lost leopards change their spots? Keane decided on a team of Peter Schmeichel; Gary Neville, Gary Pallister, Jaap Stam, Denis Irwin; David Beckham, Paul Ince, Bryan Robson, Ryan Giggs; Wayne Rooney and Cristiano Ronaldo. And the Man Utd legend explained his decision to make Schmeichel the goalkeeper despite him not being â€œas good as everyone thoughtâ€. â€œI donâ€™t like upsetting my team-mates,â€ Keane said on Sky Sportsâ€™ Monday Night Football. â€œI had to leave out some brilliant players, brilliant characters, but obviously Iâ€™ve done it. Edwin [Van der Sar] was nearly a sparring partner. â€œGoalkeepers get too much praise when they make a save. I had to go with Peter because he was very, very good â€“ not as good as everyone thought, but very good. â€œAnd obviously, I have good memories with him. He was a good character in the dressing room â€“ me and Peter certainly werenâ€™t the best of mates, absolutely far from it, but the most important thing I had for Peter â€“ and all of my team-mates â€“ was huge respect. â€œHe produced big moments and helped us get over the line in big matches, thatâ€™s the bottom line. Before you go into any match, you look over your shoulder at whoâ€™s in goal and you go, â€˜yeah, Iâ€™m happy with him â€“ weâ€™ve got a chance.â€™ Peter would produce and help us get trophies.â€ Keane selected Stam and Pallister as his two centre-backs but he felt harsh leaving Ferdinand and Steve Bruce out of his XI. The former midfielder added: â€œCentre-back was probably the hardest one because Rio was excellent, Brucey was a good character. I just couldnâ€™t leave Jaap Stam out. He didnâ€™t play as many games as the other lads but he was big, strong, brave, brilliant at one-on-ones. â€œThe other one was an issue but Iâ€™ve gone with Gary Pallister. Iâ€™d probably say [it was between Pallister and] Rio. Rio was obviously a good athlete and read the game well but my relationship with Pally was pretty good as well. â€œDid [Stam] have any real weaknesses? He could head it, he could leap, he could read the game, he was strong, aggressive, a decent lad. I got on really well with him. Unfortunately you try to move on, but Jaap was a brilliant player for Man United. Brucey was a good player and a brilliant player.â€ â€œWeâ€™d obviously play with a high line!â€ ğŸ¤£ David Beckham ğŸŒŸ Rooney ğŸ™Œ @GNev2 ğŸ‘€ Roy Keane reveals his ULTIMATE Man Utd Premier League XI ğŸ¤© pic.twitter.com/7nhb19EljG â€” Sky Sports Premier League (@SkySportsPL) May 2, 2022 Scholes and Nicky Butt were two more Man Utd legends to miss out on Keaneâ€™s team but he just couldnâ€™t see past Robson and Ince in centre midfield. Keane continued: â€œIâ€™m certainly not going to pick myself. Bryan Robson has to go in there. Bryan was a great player for Man United, full of courage, scored some big goals for the club when Man United werenâ€™t at their best. I had some brilliant days with Butty and Scholesy. â€œNext to Robbo, Iâ€™m going to put Paul Ince. Incey was a very, very good player. Maybe he tarnished his United reputation; he ended up playing at Liverpool or wherever. When he was at United, there was all talk of Incey being the governor. â€œPeople kind of held that against him but that was just banter, there was no nastiness with that. Incey was a really good teammate and a very good team-mate.â€ On leaving Cantona out, Keane said: â€œEric was a brilliant player for Man United. Iâ€™m upset to leave Eric out. Eric was a brilliant character and produced in the big games.â€

Content_title: Rio Ferdinand says this Liverpool â€˜best Iâ€™ve ever seenâ€™ as BT pundits weigh in on quadruple
Contents: Rio Ferdinand believes the current Liverpool team is the best heâ€™s ever seen and says they will surpass every English side in history if they claim the quadruple. Jurgen Kloppâ€™s side overcame Villarreal 2-0 in the first leg of their Champions League semi-final and are now huge favourites to make the final of Europeâ€™s showcase competition for the third time in five seasons. F365 says: Liverpool sidestep another obstacle that could hand them boost for title as well as Europe The quadruple would be an unprecedented feat in England and both Ferdinand and fellow BT Sport pundit Michael Owen were in awe of the Reds on Wednesday. â€œThis is the best Liverpool team Iâ€™ve ever seen,â€ Ferdinand said. â€œTheyâ€™re relentless with and without the ball. Itâ€™s the way they press teams, the energy, effort, application, you marvel at it. â€œThat [the quadruple] has got to be the aim. They are going to set themselves the target. â€œIf they achieve it theyâ€™re immortal, they are above anyone that has played the game in this country. Whether they can achieve it remains to be seen. But theyâ€™re ticking boxes along the way at the moment.â€ Former Reds striker Owen concurred with Ferdinandâ€™s assessment. â€œThis was total dominance,â€ added Owen. â€œItâ€™s the best team Iâ€™ve ever seen in a red shirt. â€œThey swarm you. Villarreal must think â€˜whatâ€™s hit us?â€™ Itâ€™s impossible to stop this unbelievable press. Theyâ€™re relentless. â€œImagine it [the quadruple]. Itâ€™s impossibleâ€¦ but now youâ€™re thinking can it happen? The way theyâ€™re playing, the belief, youâ€™re thinking can it happen?â€ Klopp said after his sideâ€™s victory that they â€œhad a lot of good momentsâ€. â€œIt was a brilliant game. The first half I liked a lot â€“ we didnâ€™t score, that was the only problem that we had,â€ Klopp said. â€œBut we kept them quiet, which was important because of the counter-attacking threat. â€œWe tried to create, tried to be direct, mix it up, play through the lines. We had a lot of good moments, no goals, true, but I was really fine with the first half. â€œAnd then in the second half, obviously we finished the situations off. Both goals were outstanding. We wanted to score a third, but from a specific moment on it makes then sense that you control the game, and that is what we did. â€œItâ€™s half-time, nothing else, but itâ€™s better than before the game.â€

Content_title: Revealed: The shocking truth behind those Ferdinand quotes about Liverpool midfielder Thiago
Contents: Pep Guardiolaâ€™s future is a point of concern after a Champions League thriller, but those Rio Ferdinand quotes on Thiago are the big news. Increasingly stranger things Ian Ladyman of the Daily Mail understandably enjoyed himself at the Etihad but something was eating him up inside: â€˜We are four years in to the second decade of Middle East ownership now and watching this incredible game of European football it was hard not to wonder what further fabulous dramas may lie ahead. â€˜More particularly, it seemed increasingly strange â€“ as City traded thunderous blows with the best team in Spain â€“ to ponder why Pep Guardiola would even think about leaving when his current contract expires at the end of next season.â€™ That does seem an â€˜increasingly strangeâ€™ angle to â€˜ponderâ€™ after â€˜watching this incredible game of European footballâ€™, which is presumably why literally no-one else did. But here we are. Guardiola has a contract that runs until 2023. He has been at Manchester City since 2016. This is already his longest unbroken spell as manager of one club by two years. That tenure, a four-year reign at Barcelona, came to an end because of a self-confessed need to â€œrecharge my batteriesâ€. It is not difficult to figure out why Guardiola might leave when his deal expires. But again, why is this hypothetical scenario that might come to pass in 13 monthsâ€™ timeeven a subject of discussion after the first leg of an enthralling Champions League semi-final? There is no answer. Only more instances of things seeming strange. â€˜This is the City team that Guardiola built and much as they were brilliantly expansive and precocious here, it is one that will only grow better, wiser and more talented from this point. â€˜Next season, for example, the Premier League leaders are expected to have the Norwegian forward Erling Haaland in their ranks. â€˜So, yes, it seems strange that Guardiola would even think about leaving as he has previously suggested he will.â€™ It would be strange if Guardiola didnâ€™t think about leaving when his current contract of employment runs out. It would be strange if Guardiola was even looking beyond May, considering this season could yet end with Manchester City winning no trophies or claiming a Premier and Champions League double. It is downright bizarre that this is such a point of focus. â€˜For all its quirks, this has the look of the greatest City team Guardiola has assembled in his six years in England. Its rivalry with Liverpool is magnetic. â€˜If Guardiola does not continue to work here beyond next season, itâ€™s hard to wonder where he will go. Even harder to work out why.â€™ It truly is impossible to predict what a man who took a sabbatical after four years of intense and uninterrupted elite coaching could potentially do after seven years of intense and uninterrupted elite coaching. Hopefully by the end of that seventh year, Ladyman has figured out the â€˜increasingly strangeâ€™ world of football contracts.  Pep talk â€˜Pep Guardiola must be furious with narrow Man City win â€“ Real Madrid are comeback kingsâ€™ â€“ the Daily Mirror headline to John Crossâ€™ opinion piece. â€˜Pep Guardiolaâ€™s delight with Manchester Cityâ€™s swashbuckling win against Real Madrid outweighed any frustration about their inability to put the Champions League semi-final to bed in a jaw-dropping first legâ€™ â€“ MailOnline.  Spill the Thi The biggest story on Wednesday, of course, is not Manchester City beating Real Madrid 4-3 in a thriller. Itâ€™s that Rio Ferdinand has said some words about Thiago Alcantara. â€˜Rio Ferdinand claims Thiago Alcantara told him he wanted to sign for Man United before joining Liverpool from Bayern Munich and says his â€˜ridiculousâ€™ form shows â€˜players need timeâ€™â€¦ as he tips Jadon Sancho to emulate him,â€™ is the beefyMailOnline headline. They add with no little specificity that â€˜Ferdinand reveals the player told him he was keen on becoming a Red Devil in 2020 when he was linked with a move away from the Bundesligaâ€™. Except Ferdinand revealed no such thing. He was asked about Manchester Unitedâ€™s previous interest in the midfielder, said that he â€œspoke to himâ€ and Thiago â€œwanted to come to Unitedâ€. But this was in 2013. Not 2020, and definitely not â€˜before joining Liverpool from Bayern Munichâ€™. Ferdinand has even spoken about this at length before on this very same podcast. Still, if one outlet blinks then others must follow: â€˜Rio Ferdinand claims Thiago Alcantara â€œwantedâ€ to join Man Utd before Liverpool transferâ€™ â€“ Daily Mirror website. â€I spoke to himâ€™ â€“ Rio Ferdinand makes Thiago transfer claim over Liverpool and Man Unitedâ€™ â€“ Liverpool Echo, who echo the demonstrably erroneous claim that â€˜the former England international has claimedThiagotold him he was keen on a move to Old Trafford in 2020â€™. â€˜Rio Ferdinand claims Thiago Alcantara told him he wanted to make Man Utd transfer before moving to rivals Liverpoolâ€™ â€“ The Sun website, who even quote Ferdinand as saying â€œI spoke to him at the time he joinedâ€ Liverpool to make it sound more current, when he said no such thing.  But credit where itâ€™s due: Manchester Evening News say â€˜Rio Ferdinand makes Thiago admission over Manchester United â€˜interestâ€™, yet they clarify that he is talking about a situation many years ago, instead of following everyone else in pretending Thiago rejected Manchester United in favour of Liverpool. Actual fair play.  Saint Etienne â€œAnfield is hell!â€ â€“ Villarrealâ€™s Etienne Capoue claims Liverpool have worst stadiumâ€™ â€¦to play at as a visiting team, as the Daily Mirror website well knows.  Trophy strife The Liverpool Echo headline: â€˜Liverpool trophy priority is clear as one cup stands out in quadruple questâ€™ The Liverpool Echo sub-headline: â€˜All Liverpool fans will want the quadruple from here if possible â€“ but is there one trophy that means more than the others?â€™ You would hope so, considering Liverpoolâ€™s â€˜trophy priority is clear as one cup stands out in quadruple questâ€™. Yet of the two writers tasked with debating the point, Sean Bradbury argues the case for the Premier League and Richard Garnett is in favour of the Champions League. Congratulations to them for having their click and eating it.

Content_title: Ferdinand claims â€˜exceptionalâ€™ Liverpool star will be â€˜fumingâ€™ to have been left out vs Villarreal
Contents: Rio Ferdinand thinks Joel Matip will be â€œfumingâ€ that he was not picked to start for Liverpool against Villarreal in the first leg of the Champions League semi-finals. The first leg takes place at Anfield on Wednesday night. Jurgen Klopp made three changes for this game. Matip, Naby Keita and Diogo Jota all dropped out. Ibrahima Konate, Jordan Henderson and Luis Diaz came into Liverpoolâ€™s starting eleven. The shocking truth behind those Ferdinand quotes about Liverpool midfielder Thiago Liverpool signed Matip in 2016 from Schalke. He is arguably enjoying his best season to date on a personal level. The 30-year-old has started 38 games across all competitions this term. Konate has featured less â€“ starting 19 games â€“ but he has impressed in his own right. Ferdinand thinks Matip has been one of the best defenders in the Premier League this season: â€œIf I am Joel Matip, I am fuming. He has been exceptional all season and we talk about being the best defenders on form in the league, he would be in there for a shout after (Virgil) Van Dijk,â€ Ferdinand said (quotes via The Express). â€œSo yeah set-pieces must be a big thing for his team selection this evening. I think the most impressive thing for me is the way [Klopp] has been able to utilise his squad. â€œJust shuffling the back at any given time, and those players are coming in and impacting the team. They are playing big roles in that, Konate is a good example for that, he has come in and scored goal after goal, and as a manager it is a dream scenario at the business end of the season.â€ Thousands of friends all round about you â¤ pic.twitter.com/ADmd4tj8m7 â€” Liverpool FC (@LFC) April 27, 2022 Michael Owen added: â€œIt is a Champions League semi-final so of course you are going to play your best team, but I think Matip all season has been number one all season, but I think the goals that Konate has scored in the past few games, he does add something different.â€ Peter Crouch went onto suggest that Liverpool will be helped by Konateâ€™s â€œdominanceâ€ in the air against Villarreal: â€œI think it is their strongest team, I think the only position you could argue is between Matip and Konate. â€œBut he has brought in (Jordan) Henderson for (Naby) Keita, and (Luis) Diaz, for (Diogo) Jota and I think for me that is the strongest squad available. â€œThe reason I think Konate has been brought in is for his dominance aerially at set pieces and he as proved to be dangerous at set-pieces in previous rounds and that can be an influence on these games.â€

Content_title: Ferdinand uses â€˜stand-outâ€™ Liverpool midfielder as example for impatient Man Utd fans
Contents: Rio Ferdinand thinks the success of Liverpool midfielder Thiago Alcantara is an example of why Man Utd fans need to be more patient with new signings. Thiago was criticised last season for playing a part in the Reds poor that saw them in sixth place in the Premier League table at the beginning of April. They recovered to finish third in the end and they have had a great season this campaign with an amazing Quadruple still within their grasp. Revealed: The shocking truth behind those Ferdinand quotes about Liverpool midfielder Thiago Thiago produced an incredible performance as Liverpool beat Man Utd 4-0 eight days ago and has put in a number of high-level displays this term. When he joined Liverpool he was regarded as one of the best midfielders in world football and he is now living up to that tag this season. â€œThiago has been the stand-out midfielder for the last few weeks and months heâ€™s been absolutely top,â€ Ferdinand said on hisVibe With FiveYouTube channel. â€œYou look at his stats. Thiagoâ€™s pass accuracy by the way in the last two games against Everton and Man Utd 98.4 percent against Everton and 95.6 percent against Everton. That is ridiculous. â€œI spoke to him at the time. He speaks perfect English, he was a great guy, wanted to come to United. But you look at him now and he couldnâ€™t be happier.â€ A number of Man Utd signings, such as Jadon Sancho and Raphael Varane, have not hit the ground running at Old Trafford and Ferdinand has urged his fellow Red Devils supporters to see Thiago as an example of players needing time to settle. â€œThere were ex-players I saw saying â€˜heâ€™s side to side, doesnâ€™t play the ball forward he isnâ€™t ready-made for this leagueâ€™. Players need time. â€œIt goes back to this thing with managers and Man Utd as well the club need to give the manager at Man Utd patience, the clubs need and the fans need to give players that come in from other leagues especially patience. â€œSancho is another example. I bet you see a better player with Sancho next season for sure.â€

Content_title: Rio Ferdinand names Man City â€˜vulnerabilityâ€™ in Real Madrid CL victory
Contents: Rio Ferdinand thinks Man City midfielder Fernandinho was their biggest â€œvulnerabilityâ€ in their 4-3 victory over Real Madrid on Tuesday night. Goals from Kevin De Bruyne, Gabriel Jesus,Phil Fodenand Bernardo Silva made sure that the Citizens kept their noses in front of Real in the first leg of their Champions League semi-final clash. Vinicius Junior had a quiet opening 45 minutes at the Etihad Stadium but came alive after the break with Fernandinho â€“ who normally plays in midfield â€“ slotting in at right-back after replacing John Stones on 36 minutes. Champions League? Youâ€™re having a right f***ing laugh Vinicius scored a brilliant individual goal for the Spanish giants in between Karim Benzemaâ€™s brace and Ferdinand thought the decision to put Fernandinho at right-back cost Man City. â€œYeah, I didnâ€™t have that. I didnâ€™t have that in training!â€ ğŸ«¢ â€œI grabbed Joleon. I said â€˜Oh my god, how dare he!'â€ ğŸ˜‚@JoleonLescott and @rioferdy5 on THAT Benzema penalty! The centre-back union can only sit back and admireâ€¦#UCL pic.twitter.com/m9BIcVbwno â€” Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) April 26, 2022 â€œIt was a fantastic game, the game ebbed and flowed in different ways,â€ Ferdinand told BT Sport. â€œMomentumchanged many times during the game, moments of absolute class from individuals. â€œCity will be a bit frustrated, you can see that. I think Pep will have a lot to say in that changing room. Real MadridI think will be buoyed I think by the way they showed the character and courage to come back. â€œBut I still fancy City to go over there [to Madrid] and finish the job off. I think a big, big change in the way the game went was when Stones coming off. I think Stonesâ€™ injury destabilised the City team. â€œUnfortunately, Fernandinho at 36 years old having to play right-back against one of the most in-form wingers in the game at the moment, that was a vulnerability then in that Man City team.â€ Fellow pundit Steve McManaman was frustrated that Man City allowed Real back into the game and thinks they shouldâ€™ve been out of sight at the end of the first leg. â€œYou never accuse City of being naÃ¯ve but they were at times,â€ McManaman added. â€œThey shouldnâ€™t have let Madrid back into the game. I donâ€™t know what it was, whether they were just overly confident because they were so far ahead, so superior, as soon as they went two goals ahead they started to drop deep, even the third goal, the Panenka penalty, they [Madrid] just had a chance prior to that, youâ€™re thinking to yourself, â€˜howâ€™s that happened?â€™. â€œCity should be just controlling the game. I still think City will score goals and probably win the game over there, the way they played, but theyâ€™ve given Madrid a glimmer of hope. â€œAnd once they go back there with the fans it will be a different scenario to tonight.â€

Content_title: Conte appointed Spurs boss â€“ lured by Levyâ€™s â€˜contagious enthusiasmâ€™
Contents: Former Chelsea boss Antonio Conte has been appointed as Tottenham Hotspurâ€™s new manager and he is â€œextremely happyâ€ to return to management. Spurs have acted quickly to appoint Conte. He replaces Nuno Espirito Santo, who was sacked on Monday. The Italian has penned an 18-month contract. He previously led Chelsea to the Premier League title in 2016/17. Antonio Conte by the numbers: Games, trophies, signingsâ€¦ He had previously been in advanced talks with Spurs in June about becoming Jose Mourinhoâ€™s successor, but they broke down after the two parties were at odds over key issues. However, managing director Fabio Paratici is now in position at the Premier League club and has a strong relationship with the 52-year-old, having worked with him at Juventus. And those differences have now been overcome, with chairman Daniel Levy looking to the serial winner to turn Spurs back into a force in English football. â€œI am extremely happy to return to coaching, and to do so at a Premier League club that has the ambition to be a protagonist again,â€ Conte told the club website. â€œTottenham Hotspur has state-of-the-art facilities and one of the best stadiums in the world. â€œI canâ€™t wait to start working to convey to the team and the fans the passion, mentality and determination that have always distinguished me, as a player and as a coach. â€œLast summer our union did not happen because the end of my relationship with Inter was still too recent and emotionally too involved with the end of the season, so I felt that it wasnâ€™t yet the right time to return to coaching. â€œBut the contagious enthusiasm and determination of Daniel Levy in wanting to entrust me with this task had already hit the mark. Now that the opportunity has returned, I have chosen to take it with great conviction.â€ Nuno was relieved of his duties after Levy and Paratici met on Sunday to discuss his future, with the news delivered early on Monday morning. The Portuguese was a condemned man following Saturdayâ€™s 3-0 home loss to Manchester United, when fans chanted â€˜You donâ€™t know what youâ€™re doingâ€™ and roundly booed him at full-time. Spurs have lost five of the last seven Premier League games and have gone two hours and 16 minutes without having a shot on goal. Conte inherits a team in ninth position in the table, five points off the top four after 10 games. The Italian, who is expected to be given some funds in January to strengthen the squad, is due to take training on Tuesday and be in charge of Thursdayâ€™s Europa Conference League clash with Vitesse Arnhem. He becomes the fourth manager to cross the divide between Stamford Bridge and north London, following Glenn Hoddle, Andre Villas-Boas and Mourinho in managing both clubs. Paratici said: â€œWe are delighted to welcome Antonio to the club. His track record speaks for itself, with vast experience and trophies in both Italy and England. â€œI know first-hand the qualities Antonio can bring to us, having worked with him at Juventus, and look forward to seeing his work with our talented group of players.â€ Spurs said an update on Conteâ€™s coaching staff will follow in due course.

Content_title: Conte reveals that Son knew he was coming off before scoring Tottenham stunner
Contents: Son Heung-min was told that he would be coming off shortly before scoring a superb goal in Tottenhamâ€™s 3-1 win over Leicester, Antonio Conte has revealed. Son grabbed his second of the game and 19th of the season in style as he curled a 20-yard effort into the top corner to put the seal on Spursâ€™ victory. Spurs settle another set of jitters with a masterclass from Son Heung-min He had earlier set up Harry Kaneâ€™s opener from a corner and doubled the lead when he turned and shot on the hour mark. The quality of the goal left Conte wondering which was Sonâ€™s strongest foot, but the Italian said moments like that will only count for something if Spurs achieve their goal of finishing in the top six. â€œI gave him a big hug because after an amazing goal my question was which is his favourite foot, right or left?â€ Conte said. â€œHe scored a fantastic goal and three minutes before when I spoke with him I said, â€˜Go for five or six minutes and then I have to make a changeâ€™. â€œI said to him that when you listened that I wanted to make a change and you decide to score this amazing goal. â€œWe are talking about a great player, fantastic player. But itâ€™s important at the end of the season to celebrate a big achievement with the team. Otherwise it remains only a personal success only to score these types of goals.â€ OH SONNY YOU BEAUTY â€” Tottenham Hotspur (@SpursOfficial) May 1, 2022 The victory saw Spurs get back on track in their quest for Champions League qualification after taking one point in their previous two games. Conte knew it was especially important to win as they visit title-chasing Liverpool next weekend. â€œIt was a good performance against a really good team,â€ he said. â€œThe game wasnâ€™t easy and we knew very well that despite them making eight changes from the last game against Roma you can see the quality, you can see the squad that Leicester has. â€œI think then we deserved to win the game. â€œFor sure we got three points in an important moment of the season, especially because in the next games we are going to face first Liverpool and then Arsenal. â€œToday it was vital to get three points. There is only one result and a lot of pressure, but I said to my players to live this moment, to enjoy this moment because we deserved it after really great work that we did in these six months. â€œI think no one at the start of the season could imagine Tottenham challenging for a place in the Champions League, especially in November when there was a change, and for this reason we have to be satisfied that we stay in this position to fight for a big achievement.â€

Content_title: Conte dismisses PSG rumours as â€˜fake newsâ€™ as Spurs boss focuses on Champions League â€˜miracleâ€™
Contents: Tottenham boss Antonio Conte has described speculation linking him with the Paris St Germain job as â€œfake newsâ€. Reports emerged in France and Italy earlier this week suggesting Conte was interested in replacing Mauricio Pochettino at the Ligue 1 club. READ MORE: Champions League â€˜festival of footballâ€™ plans are yet another affront to supporters Conte, who has 12 months left on his contract, has continually refused to commit his long-term future to Spurs, but insists the latest round of speculation is not true. He said: â€œObviously I think that itâ€™s good that other clubs appreciate my work. This is one thing. But the truth is that I donâ€™t like when people try to invest news â€“ only to speak, only to create problems. â€œThis is not right, not fair for me, for the clubs involved and for my players. â€œAlso because weâ€™re really focused on these five games to get a fantastic result for us. I repeat, this type of situation makes me smile. â€œBut I think that also the people that want to tell something about this have to show respect for all the people involved in this situation, and not invent fake news and tell a lot of lies. â€œIn this situation, who works in football â€“ players or managers â€“ know very well that at this point of the season, a lot of fake news starts to go out.â€ The Italian does not want this issue to be a distraction for the clubâ€™s push for Champions League qualification. Spurs are two points behind Arsenal with five games to go and Conte has called on a joint effort to get over the line. â€œIn this moment our fans, me, the players, the club, the fans we need to be focused, we need to be concentrated on an important target for us,â€ he said. â€œWe have a big opportunity to try to get a place in the Champions League. â€œItâ€™s a big opportunity for us because no one can imagine to stay and fight for this target in this league now in this moment. In the past it was different, but now you know very well what I said in the past that it would be a miracle to get this achievement. â€œWe are doing something special for the situation we faced this season. I spoke with my players and its the same with our fans, they have to continue to support us and push us until the end. â€œWeâ€™re living this dream. We have to continue until the end to get a place in the Champions League. Itâ€™s right to underline that we are fighting for a target that wasnâ€™t in our mind at the start of the season. â€œFor this reason I want to push everybody at the club to have great enthusiasm, great passion, our fans to stay with us and to back us from the start until the end. â€œNow it would be very important to be focused and not listen to fake news and the people that for sure want to create problems for the environment. â€œWe have to play these five games and then you know, because I answer a lot of times, that at the end of the season in a private way I will speak with my club and I will see the best solution. â€œWeâ€™re working very hard and my players know very well weâ€™re very focused. Weâ€™re speaking a lot about this opportunity. â€œWe have to live this situation with passion, enthusiasm and joy. I repeat, we deserve to stay there and to fight for a place in the Champions League. A place in Champions League is not easy for no one. â€œTo stay there, we need to enjoy this situation. For this reason, I repeat our fans have to stay with us at every moment. Positive and negative moments. We deserve to fight until the end and have a big push from our fans.â€ Spurs will be without Sergio Reguilon for Sundayâ€™s game against Leicester as he has a groin problem. The Spaniard joins Oliver Skipp (pubis), Japhet Tanganga and Matt Doherty (both knee) in the treatment room.

Content_title: Tottenham add two managers to their shortlist as doubts grow over Conteâ€™s future
Contents: Tottenham have added Graham Potter and Roberto Mancini to their list of possible alternatives to Mauricio Pochettino as doubts grow over Antonio Conteâ€™s future at the club, according to reports. Spurs have been improving since Conte took over in early November to replace Nuno Espirito Santo, who lost five of his last seven Premier League matches to leave the club ninth in the table. Since then, Tottenham have gradually risen up the table and now find themselves fifth, two points off fourth-placed Arsenal with five matches to play. Champions League â€˜festival of footballâ€™ plans are yet another affront to supporters Spurs have the Gunners to play in the north London derby in a fortnightâ€™s time with the match probably going a long way to deciding which of the two teams will play Champions League football next season. However, there have been rumours that Conte could jump ship this summer whatever happens in the final straight with a report insisting that the Italian has offered himself to Paris Saint-Germain. Pochettino is almost certain to leave this summer, with the manager and PSG attempting to agree a compensation package which would allow him to depart, as the French giants would have to fork outâ‚¬15m to sack him. The report on Monday claimed that there has also been â€˜contactâ€™ between Pochettino and Daniel Levy with the Tottenham chairman â€˜trying to convince the coach to return to Spursâ€™. And now the Daily Mail say that Tottenham are â€˜looking at alternativesâ€™ to Pochettino if Conte attempts to exit this summer â€˜withGraham Potterand Roberto Mancini among the names set to be consideredâ€™. It is understood that Pochettino is â€˜largely viewed as the ideal candidate to replace the Italianâ€™ but â€˜there is some opposition from within the Tottenham hierarchyâ€™ to his potential return. That â€˜resistance has led the club to explore other avenuesâ€™ with Potter and Mancini emerging as possible options. Brighton manager Potter was linked with a move to Spurs in the summer when Nuno was appointed and just before Conteâ€™s arrival in north London. The Daily Mail adds that Tottenham have â€˜long admired the work Potter has accomplished at Brighton and will be on the clubâ€™s radar if they find themselves trying to replace Conte this summerâ€™. Mancini, who is currently manager of the Italian national team, is also â€˜an optionâ€™ with Spursâ€™ managing director of football Fabio Paratici â€˜an admirerâ€™ of the former Manchester City boss. The Daily Mail adds: â€˜Itâ€™s important to stress that Tottenhamâ€™s due diligence towards the appointment of Conteâ€™s successor remains a matter of contingency preparation, with sources indicating succession planning at football clubs is completely normal. â€˜Indeed, Tottenhamâ€™s plan A is for Conte to stay in charge heading into next season â€“ and there is a feeling behind the scenes that he will not walk away.â€™

Content_title: Conte told heâ€™s â€˜more passionate about his chequebookâ€™ than Spurs
Contents: Paris Saint-Germain should not pursue Antonio Conte because heâ€™s â€œmore passionate about his chequebookâ€ than Spurs, according to former France international Jerome Rothen. Reports emerged this week linking Conte with a move to PSG with the French club apparently set to move on Mauricio Pochettino at the end of the season. Pochettino is likely to win the Ligue 1 title this campaign but their failure to advance beyond the Round of 16 in the Champions League has sealed his fate. Is Pochettino a better manager for Spurs than Conte? AndLe Parisien has claimed that Conte â€˜has already offered himself upâ€™ to PSG and there have been rumours that Daniel Levy would like Pochettino to return to Spurs. Conte has a reputation for short stints in jobs, while there have been rumours that the Spurs boss wants a Â£30m wage package to take over at the French giants and former PSG winger Rothen thinks heâ€™s the wrong man for the job. Rothen said on RMC Sport show Rothen Sâ€™enflamme (via Sport Witness): â€œOf course not. When you hear these demands, stay where you are. Certainly donâ€™t come to a club like PSG, who need to improve their image, one far more healthy. â€œYou need people who are passionate about football, and Iâ€™m not saying Conte isnâ€™t, but he seems more passionate about his chequebook than managing Tottenham, PSG or another team. Thatâ€™s already problematic.â€ âš¡ @RothenJerome : Quand tu entends les exigences de Conteâ€¦ Mais reste oÃ¹ tu es ! Ne viens surtout pas au PSG.â€ #RMClive pic.twitter.com/JkegJn6Fn0 â€” Rothen sâ€™enflamme (@Rothensenflamme) April 26, 2022 However, Rothen did admit that if the right director of football came in to replace Leonardo, with Conte as his choice for manager, then he might look at things from a different perspective. When asked if Conte would be a good appointment if he came in for the â€œright reasonsâ€, Rothen added: â€œYes, every day, because Conte brings that grinta, and I think that he identifies really quickly with the club he manages, but not with those financial conditions. Thatâ€™s not possible.â€ The reports linking Conte to PSG have reportedly â€˜irritatedâ€™ Spurs chairman Levy after having a similar â€˜distractionâ€™ last summer when speculation was rife around Harry Kaneâ€™s future.

Content_title: Is Pochettino a better manager for Spurs than Conte?
Contents: Making the emotional case from the heat for a Pochettino-Spurs reunion is easy. But what about from the head? Itâ€™s no great surprise that Mauricio Pochettino looks set to lose his job as PSG manager. Having failed to win the Champions League, not even romping home to the Ligue 1 title was ever going to save him. Even so, the speed with which the Parisiens have apparently set about binning him off is a brutal old business. Itâ€™s been a strange spell in Paris for Pochettino. It has, predictably, brought the trophies his CV lacked. It has, just as predictably, exposed the disingenuous nature of the previous arguments against his coaching talents because he hadnâ€™t won trophies. Because it was never really about the trophies; it never is. Itâ€™s just using whatever stick is available to beat the target of your criticism. Had he won a Carabao or FA Cup with his magnificent Spurs side, the â€˜no trophiesâ€™ argument would simply have become â€˜only a Carabaoâ€™. Even winning the 2019 Champions League would simply have been memory-holed and written off as a freak occurrence. If that sounds implausible, just have a look at what Manchester United fans were saying when people started talking up the City-Liverpool rivalry as the Premier Leagueâ€™s greatest. â€˜Only one Premier League titleâ€™ was the cudgel against Liverpool and Klopp. Anything can be written off if itâ€™s inconvenient. Pochettino has done precisely as well as anyone could have realistically expected at PSG, but inevitably that has seen his stock fall. Anyone could win Ligue 1 with PSG, itâ€™s meaningless, as long as you ignore the fact that Thomas Tuchel could not pull it off last season. And no manager has delivered the Champions League title they crave and it remains doubtful whether any manager can overcome the disadvantage that comes from trying to level up from a weaker domestic league to the teak-tough knockout stages. His reign in Paris has been flawed as it was always likely to be. His next job after Spurs always had to be one of the superclubs, but PSG always seemed the very worst fit despite his links to the club in its former guise as just a football club. Pochettinoâ€™s ethos is all about the collective â€“ â€œyou sign a contract to train, not to playâ€ â€“ and that was never a good fit for a club that is a branding and promotional tool first and football team second. The superstars will play, must play, and thatâ€™s that. His detractors use his flawed spell in Paris as evidence that there remains something second tier about him, that he isnâ€™t quite up to the biggest jobs. Really all that we know is that he wasnâ€™t right for this specific one of the biggest jobs. The criticism is unsurprising, but what is strange is that there also now seems to be some negative retrospective reappraisal of his time at Spurs, much of it coming from Spurs fans themselves. Nothing that has happened to either Spurs or Pochettino since his departure appears to support this view, but itâ€™s definitely there. And thatâ€™s because, inevitably, the news of his imminent Paris exit sparks talk of a Spurs return. The timing is key here, because even a couple of weeks ago it would not have played out quite the same. When the Manchester United job was still available and Antonio Conteâ€™s Spurs appeared to have struck gold by simply scoring four goals every week, the talk would have been more in the direction of United. But Erik Ten Hag is in at Manchester United, and Spurs have gone two moribund games without a shot on target against Brighton and Brentford. Conte is once again making eyes at the exit door and uncertainty has returned. Champions League football has also gone from â€˜probableâ€™ to â€˜unlikelyâ€™. So would and should Spurs consider bringing Poch back? The case from the heart is easily made. There is without doubt unfinished business on both sides here, and Pochettino has made no secret of his desire to return to the club one day. The appeal of just running with the energia universal vibes and bringing him back, re-signing Christian Eriksen and re-swapping Bryan Gil for Erik Lamela should be obvious even to those dreary trophy-counters turned trophy-dismissers. But is there an argument to be made with the head? Weâ€™re saying yes. And itâ€™s this. Antonio Conte is a better manager than Mauricio Pochettino, but is he a better Spurs manager at this moment? Thatâ€™s less clear-cut.  The reports of his interest in the PSG job coming moments after news that Pochettino was likely on his way out are the key. His camp moved to brief against those reports, but the fact is that even if not true they are entirely believable and plausible. He is not a manager for the long haul at even the biggest clubs, and certainly not at Spurs. He has achieved a lot in a short space of time in the â€œpainful rebuildâ€ that was already overdue when Pochettino left Spurs in 2019 and became more and more urgent as Jose Mourinho huffed and sulked around the place for a year and a half. If he were a manager Spurs could realistically keep for five years, then everything Conte has done since November would be fine and dandy. From where he found them they had no business being in Champions League contention this season. If this was stage one of a proper new five-year plan they would be ahead of schedule. But with Conte, Spurs are always against the clock. His contract runs only to the end of next season and even that looks a long way away. The possible 12-month extension to that contract even more so. There is no escaping the sense that however things are currently going in what has been an up-and-down five months he has always had and will always have one eye on the exit door. Spurs will always be in this curious stalled position while Conte is manager. Heâ€™s not going to instantly turn them into top-level contenders again because nobody could, but any improvements he does make â€“ and there have been plenty â€“ are caveated into oblivion by the near-certain knowledge that he wonâ€™t be around to finish the job. Under Conte, Spurs are far better than they were without him, but it all feels oddly directionless. He is laying solid foundations for a palace that will never be built. Under Pochettino, Spurs would at the very least have the prospect of a manager who might still be around to finish what he started. And even if it did go horribly wrong, as the â€œnever go backâ€ truism and the fact this is Spurs suggest is quite likely, the closure that would provide â€“ even if painful â€“ is something both club and manager need to properly move on.
