Transfer gossip: Man Utd to move for free-agent Dybala while Arsenal target Rashford But the German will still work for the Old Trafford giants in the consultancy role agreed when he took over. In a statement, Rangnick said: â€œI will take over as national team manager of Austria at the end of the season but will continue my consultancy with Manchester United. â€œIâ€™m really looking forward to playing my part in helping United become a real force again.â€ The PA news agency understands Man Utd have been supportive of Rangnick taking the job with Austria, with the advisory position always holding the option for the 63-year-old to take on parallel roles. Rangnick has been given an initial two-year deal that will automatically be extended by a further two years if Austria qualify for Euro 2024. Lars Kornetka will be his assistant. Speaking after Man Utd drew 1-1 against Chelsea last night, Rangnick was coy over the possibility of managing Austria. Asked if he had accepted that job, he said: â€œTonight is about our game against Chelsea and I donâ€™t want to speak about anything else. â€œPlease accept that and respect that, so please only ask questions about tonightâ€™s game.â€ Pushed on the Austria role, Rangnick said: â€œNo (I wonâ€™t comment on it). Let us speak about the game. â€œWhat I can tell you and confirm is that I will definitely continue with my consultancy role at the end of the season for the next two years and I am very much looking forward to that. â€œWe havenâ€™t spoken, Erik and myself, but we have spoken with the board about the content and the profile of the job. â€œThe content of that consultancy role we spoke about. Thatâ€™s why I can now confirm that I will definitely continue with that at the end of the season.â€

Content_title: Carragher makes Everton comparison as Ronaldo return made Man Utd look like â€˜small clubâ€™
Contents: Jamie Carragher has argued that Manchester United were made to look like a â€œsmall clubâ€ when they decided to bring Cristiano Ronaldo back. After his spells at Real Madrid and Juventus, Ronaldo returned to the Red Devils last summer. A fee of around Â£13.5m plus add-ons was paid by Man Utd. The forward has been criticised by some this season but he has been one of few bright sparks for United. Juan Mata shows Man United what theyâ€™ve wasted in beautiful Old Trafford swansong The 37-year-old scored his 24th goal of the season on Monday night as Man Utd beat Brentford 3-0 at Old Trafford. Carragher has often questioned Unitedâ€™s decision to re-sign Ronaldo and he did so again on Monday. He does not feel that they â€œshould not be buying a 37-year-oldâ€: â€œMy problem has always been with Man United for buying Cristiano Ronaldo. One of the biggest clubs in the world should not be buying a 37-year-old,â€ Carragher told Sky Sports. â€œIâ€™ve always been of the opinion that they should move him on, but right now, there are so many problems â€“ â€˜I need to get a midfielder, I need to get a centre-back.â€™ Weâ€™ve seen this season that when Ronaldo doesnâ€™t play or gets brought off, itâ€™s a massive story. â€œIf you bring in strikers, are they to play or back up Ronaldo? If youâ€™re the new manager, you might think you donâ€™t need that on your plate. â€œTheyâ€™ve got other problems. Would Liverpool ring back Luis Suarez? I donâ€™t think so. United should be getting Erling Haaland. Man City are getting him. â€œItâ€™s like United are a small club. Itâ€™s like when Rooney went back to Everton. It was just to lift the fans.â€ Carragher also thinks itâ€™s â€œnonsenseâ€ that Ralf Rangnick will be managing Austria next season. The former Liverpool defender said on Sky Sports: â€œRalf Rangnick isnâ€™t really a manager, heâ€™s a director of football, heâ€™s someone who helps the coaches or builds the club. â€œIâ€™ll be honest with you I just donâ€™t get that. I donâ€™t think you can be manager of Austria and work for Manchester United. â€œHe can work for Manchester United in that roleâ€¦well thatâ€™s wrong. That should not be happening. â€œThe manager of Austria should not be working part time for Manchester United. Thatâ€™s just a nonsense! Itâ€™s one or the other.â€

Content_title: Carragher explains why Liverpool have â€˜slight edgeâ€™ in title race
Contents: Jamie Carragher reckons Liverpool â€œhave the slight edgeâ€ over Manchester City in the race for the Premier League title. The Reds and the Citizens have matched each others last four results as both sides look to avoid slipping up at a crucial moment in their pursuit of the title. City currently lead Liverpool by one point with five matches of the campaign remaining with Jurgen Kloppâ€™s side appearing to have the tougher run of fixtures. Big Midweek: City v Real, Danjuma at Anfield, West Ham, Rangnick, Forest However, Carragher believes both sides â€“ who have only lost five matches all season between them â€“ will drop points before the end of the season but that the forwards at Liverpoolâ€™s disposal gives them the â€œslight edgeâ€. â€œWeâ€™re talking about two brilliant teams,â€ Carragher on Sky Sportsâ€™ Monday Night Football. â€œYou canâ€™t really split them in an area of the game, but I can see both of them dropping points, I do believe that. â€œIf you look at the attacking stats, this is when Liverpool have the slight edge, you look at the goals per game they have the slight edge. â€œLiverpool have scored 85 goals, Man City 80, when you talk about not having a striker the goals are still absolutely phenomenal from Man City. â€œThe XG per game shows that Liverpool have the edge.Man Cityâ€™s top scorer is De Bruyne with 11, and for Liverpool itâ€™s Salah with 22. Thereâ€™s a big difference. â€œMan City obviously spread the goals out a bit more, but the numbers in terms of their top scorers show Liverpool have a big advantage in attack.â€ ğŸ—£ â€œThis is where Liverpool have the slight edge.â€ Jamie Carragher pinpoints where Manchester City could drop points in their remaining Premier League games. pic.twitter.com/m8coIUZQMa â€” Football Daily (@footballdaily) April 25, 2022 Carragher added: â€œIf Man City are to drop points, it would be down to the fact they could have games where they fail to score. â€œMan City have failed to score in four games this season â€“ Liverpool only one â€“ and they have only scored once in seven games too, so thatâ€™s 11 games where they have scored one goal or zero goals. â€œSo, you think, if Man City are going to drop points, it must be from a 0-0, thereâ€™s been evidence of that this season in games that weâ€™ve seen.â€ Speaking about both sideâ€™s defensive capabilities, Carragher continued: â€œWe should add that lot of those games where Liverpool dropped points were early on in the season and there has been a change, defensively, in the second half of the season. â€œBut, if Liverpool drop points, you feel like it wouldnâ€™t be a 0-0, it would be a 2-2. â€œThe perceived weaknesses of the two sides are that City havenâ€™t got a striker, and Liverpoolâ€™s high line. But I think in some ways those are both strengths for them as well. â€œThe defensive stats show City have the edge. Most people would say Liverpool have the best defender in the world in Virgil van Dijk, but as a team, City are better defensively and that might have something to do with not having a striker. â€œMaybe having more control of the ball in the game means people canâ€™t attack them.Again the numbers are very close. Man City just have the edge. â€œWhere there is a big difference is the xG per game. Itâ€™s almost a third higher for Liverpool. â€œThereâ€™s nothing in the clean sheets but the big one that stands out is that Manchester City have only conceded one goal from a set-piece, Liverpool seven.â€

Content_title: â€˜Liverpool class my a*seâ€™ â€“ Everton legend hits out at Sky Sports â€˜biasâ€™
Contents: Former Everton defender Alan Stubbs says he had to mute the commentary on Sky Sports because it was â€œso biasedâ€ towards Liverpool. The Reds beat the Toffees in the Merseyside derby 2-0 on Sunday but Frank Lampardâ€™s side made life difficult for their arch-rivals before Andy Robertson broke the deadlock on 62 minutes. Jurgen Klopp brought Divock Origi and Luis Diaz off the bench and the changes worked as Origi headed in the second goal from Diazâ€™s acrobatic effort and the Belgium international also had a hand in the opener. Hereâ€™s hoping for Everton relegation after Lampard elitism There were a few controversial moments in the game with Everton feeling they shouldâ€™ve had a second-half penalty, while Sadio Mane was perhaps fortunate to stay on the pitch after poking Mason Holgate in the face. Stubbs tweeted: â€œWill have to turn this commentary off I think @Everton because itâ€™s so biased!! â€œRicharlison clearly goes over on his ankle and is accused of cheating!! Liverpool class my a**e.â€ Will have to turn this commentary off I think @everton because itâ€™s so biased!! Richarlison clearly goes over on his ankle and is accused of cheating!! Liverpool class my arse ğŸ¤·ğŸ¼â€â™‚ï¸ğŸ’™ â€” Alan Stubbs (@alanstubbs_6) April 24, 2022 Carragher annoyed a number of fans on social media after the former Liverpool centre-back told Richarlison to get up despite the Everton attacker rolling his ankle. â€œHonestly, get up. Get up, carry on,â€ Carragher said of Richarlison on commentary. â€œIf [Abdoulaye] Doucoure gets a yellow card because his teammate goes down. Stupid from Doucoure trying to stop the game but Richarlisonâ€¦ thereâ€™s nothing wrong with him.â€ Stubbs appeared this morning on BBC Radio Five Live and he revealed his frustration that major decisions went against Everton. He said: â€œEverton had a game plan to try and frustrate Liverpool and they did that for large parts of the game. Some major decisions also went against them, for instance the penalty. The first incident isnâ€™t but the second one (Matip on Gordon) is a clear penalty there is no doubt about that. The referee is in a great position and he bottled it. There is no other way to describe it. â€œEverton have been on the end of dubious VAR decisions in recent months but that is not the reason they are in the position they are in.â€ When asked whether Everton will stay up, Stubbs added: â€œI hope so. I have everything crossed. But itâ€™s going to be close.â€ Stubbs also urged the players to show they have what it takes to stay in the Premier League after Burnleyâ€™s victory on Saturday plunged the Toffees into the relegation zone. Stubbs continued: â€œI know Frank Lampardâ€™s record doesnâ€™t look great but he has inherited a group of players where a lot of the damage was done before him and he had to pick up the pieces. â€œCould he have done more? Certainly. But ultimately it comes down to the players. They have not performed well enough this season, though there has been signs of improvement in the last three performances. â€œWhen you are down the bottom every run-in is tough. They have another tough game on Sunday at home to Chelsea. â€œItâ€™s not about talk, itâ€™s about actions. We have heard the talk all season about â€˜we are too good to go downâ€™. Well now is the time for the players to stand up and be counted.â€

Content_title: Pundit claims â€˜the referee bottledâ€™ Everton penalty in Liverpool loss
Contents: Former Everton striker Kevin Campbell thinks the Toffees shouldâ€™ve been awarded a penalty in their 2-0 loss to Liverpool on Sunday. Jurgen Klopp changed the game by bringing on Divock Origi and Luis Diaz in the second half with the former involved in the build-up to Andy Robertsonâ€™s opening goal before getting on the scoresheet himself. Everton youngster Anthony Gordon was booked for diving in the first half under a challenge from Naby Keita and the simulation came back to haunt him in the second half as he was denied a penalty. â€˜Good riddance, Evertonâ€™, says the Merseyside derby Mailboxâ€¦ With the score still level at 0-0, Gordon â€“ who had caused Liverpool problems all game â€“ went down after being bundled over by Joel Matip but the referee waved away his penalty protests. But Campbell was adamant that it shouldâ€™ve been a spot-kick and insists the referee â€œbottledâ€ the decision. Campbell said on Sky Sports: â€œThis is a pen for me. Itâ€™s a push in the back. Heâ€™s in the box, itâ€™s a push in the back. Heâ€™s nowhere near the ball, he pushes him. â€œYou see that. If that was at the other end, Iâ€™m sure this stadium would have gone crazy. Thatâ€™s the one break that Everton needed. â€œI thought the referee bottled it a little bit, if Iâ€™m honest with you.â€ ğŸ—£ â€œIâ€™ve gone one v one with him and Iâ€™ve got the better of him and heâ€™s stood on me foot.â€ Anthony Gordon explains why he feels he shouldâ€™ve had a penalty and that he didnâ€™t deserve a yellow card for his â€œdiveâ€ pic.twitter.com/lhCkgxiwqB â€” Football Daily (@footballdaily) April 24, 2022 Former Liverpool centre-back Jamie Carragher warned Gordon that he doesnâ€™t want to get a reputation as a diver. Carragher added: â€œHeâ€™s got to be careful, Anthony Gordon. Heâ€™s a great lad and a great player, one of the best players on the pitch today, caused Liverpool massive problems. â€œBut heâ€™s just got to be careful of that, itâ€™s not the first time, the one in the first half, and it definitely will be in refereeâ€™s heads.â€ Fellow pundit Graeme Souness reckons Gordon â€œplanted a seedâ€ in the refereeâ€™s mind after the simulation in the first half. Souness said: â€œHeâ€™s planted a seed in the refereeâ€™s head, in the very first few minutes when he dived to try and get a penalty. â€œYou can bet, if weâ€™re players out there, weâ€™re in the refereeâ€™s ear: â€˜heâ€™s a diver, ref.â€™ Youâ€™re planting a seed in the refâ€™s head as well.â€

Content_title: Carra: Everton â€˜cheatedâ€™ fans this season after resilient derby display
Contents: Jamie Carragher has blasted the Everton players after they put in a rare positive performance against Liverpool on Sunday. The Toffees frustrated Jurgen Kloppâ€™s men at Anfield but ultimately fell to a 2-0 defeat after Andy Robertson opened the scoring in the 62nd minute before Divock Origi sealed the win for the hosts. Jorginho, Chelsea blushes saved as top four all but secure Frank Lampardâ€™s men looked dangerous on the counter-attack, resilient in defence and did everything in their power to annoy the opposition players and the Anfield crowd. Everton are now in the bottom three, two points behind Burnley, with their Premier League status in great jeopardy. After such an impressive performance against Liverpool â€“ who are chasing a quadruple â€“ Carragher has claimed that the Everton players have â€œcheatedâ€ their fans and managers this season. Carragher told Sky Sports:â€œThe Everton players have been cheating their manager and their fans this season. Carragherâ€™s exasperated â€œhonestly, GET UP!â€ here is absolutely brilliant ğŸ˜‚ pic.twitter.com/RG0koDobjs â€” FootballJOE (@FootballJOE) April 24, 2022 â€œTo put in a performance as good as that against one of the best teams in the world at the moment and at one of the hardest places to play football? They made it so difficult for Liverpool and had a real fight today. â€œThey need to look at themselves because now theyâ€™re in the bottom three and they have to start fighting for their lives.â€ Ex-Everton striker Kevin Campbell added:â€œWhatâ€™s happened at Everton is nothing short of disgraceful. A lot of money has been spent on the squad and you expect them to be higher up the league. For a club like Everton not to win away from home since August is ridiculous.â€ Graeme Souness says he wants the Toffees to avoid the drop, but is not holding his breath. The former Reds captain said:â€œIt was the easiest way to play football for Everton. They didnâ€™t ask the players to step up and play football, everyone was back in their own half. The only threat they had was Anthony Gordon in a race with Trent Alexander-Arnold down the left. â€œIâ€™m not pooh-poohing their attitude â€“ Iâ€™d just say itâ€™s not that they played well. It was just about sitting in and trying to nick it. Can they do that every week? Iâ€™m not sure. â€œI want Everton to survive. I lived in the city for a long time. They are a big proud football club with a fantastic history. Itâ€™s going to be difficult for them though. They canâ€™t play like this in the last six games. Theyâ€™ve got to go out and get some points.â€

Content_title: Simon Jordan claims Pep Guardiola â€˜would have struggledâ€™ at Man Utd in Ralf Rangnickâ€™s role
Contents: Simon Jordan has suggested that Pep Guardiola â€œwould have struggledâ€ if he was in charge of Man Utd for six months. Ralf Rangnick became Unitedâ€™s interim manager back in December. One candidate ruled out as tabloid obsession over Manchester United captaincy continues Erik ten Hag has been confirmed as the clubâ€™s new permanent boss ahead of this summer. Rangnick has only won ten of his 26 games in charge of Man Utd across all competitions. They exited the Champions League and they are five points adrift of the top four. It was announced on Friday that Rangnick will be Austriaâ€™s new manager. It is worth noting that he will continue working for Man Utd in a consultancy capacity. Jordan believes that â€œthe whole outlook is wrongâ€ at Man Utd currently: â€œI felt [Ralf] Rangnick would go into Manchester United and he would be a sea change, and have the courage of his convictions to be able to put his foot down,â€ Jordan told talkSPORT. â€œI think it is much more difficult than that, the entire culture at Manchester United is wrong. The fabric of the playing squad is wrong, they have bought the wrong players, and they are going to have to change it. â€œI think if you put Pep Guardiola in for six months, he would have struggled with the current crop of players. â€œThe attitude and outlook of disposition of that football club from the owners, to the fans, the whole outlook is wrong. â€œThe fans are not satisfied because of the Glazers and the performance of the team, but anybody could have done it for six months. â€œBut why would he want to be a consultant? He is a person who makes decisions and wants to implement them. â€œThe problem is that he wasnâ€™t involved in the selection process of the manager â€“ he obviously has not been as Erik ten Hag has not spoken to him. â€œAs a consultant, he basically parachutes in and looks at other peopleâ€™s work, and let others implement his decisions.â€ Jordan went onto suggest that Darren Fletcher and John Murtough should be â€œworking a little bit lower down the food chainâ€: â€œDarren Fletcher is not fit for purpose in his role, and neither is John Murtough â€“ you need to get the best in class. â€œI am sure they are very decent individuals, but perhaps they should be working a little bit lower down the food chain inside Manchester United, so the club can start to bridge the gap. â€œNot just on the pitch, but off it, because off it will influence what happens on it.â€

Content_title: Neville blasts â€˜messyâ€™ Man Utd plan as he reacts to Rangnickâ€™s job news
Contents: Gary Neville doubts that Ralf Rangnick can effectively be Austria manager and a consultant for Man Utd at the same time. It was confirmed on Friday that Rangnick will become the new Austria boss at the end of the season with the Man Utd interim boss outlining his intention to continue at Old Trafford as a consultant. But Neville admitted on his Sky Sports podcast that he doesnâ€™t like the idea of Rangnick splitting his time between the two jobs. One candidate ruled out as tabloid obsession over Manchester United captaincy continues Reacting to the news that Rangnick was set to become the new Austria boss, Neville said: â€œManchester Unitedâ€™s Sporting Director or consultant can he really be going looking at Austrian players, week in, week out? And then selecting them for the national team? â€œThe Austrian national team has pride, great country and some great players so heâ€™ll have to watch players all week then heâ€™s going to go and coach them for two weeks in September, October, November and March. So youâ€™re saying to yourself whatâ€™s happening with the Manchester United consultancy advice? â€œWhere is the priority? Thereâ€™s a conflict there.â€ The former Man Utd defender added: â€œI donâ€™t see that. I donâ€™t see how that can work, youâ€™re a national team manager and Iâ€™ve worked under a national team manager, that national team manager has got to present week in, week out, Saturday, Wednesday, Saturday, Tuesday and he canâ€™t be here at Old Trafford every week watching an Austrian player play. â€œI canâ€™t see how thatâ€™s going to work, if itâ€™s something thatâ€™s true. Maybe (itâ€™s a compromise) but itâ€™s messy, Manchester United canâ€™t afford at this moment to have distractions, canâ€™t afford at this moment in time to have a poor communications plan around the idea that Ralf Rangnickâ€™s our football consultant but heâ€™s seen watching German football three times a month then going coaching the Austrian team two times a month. â€œThatâ€™s not going to work because people are going to say â€˜hang on, whoâ€™s in the directorâ€™s box? Whatâ€™s Darren Fletcher doing? Whatâ€™s John Murtough doing? Whatâ€™s Ralf Rangnick doing wherever heâ€™s watching an Austrian player? â€œI donâ€™t think they can afford that at this moment in time. Laser-focused, clear lines, people staying in their lines understanding what their roles are and actually communicating that to a fan base, this is a real change, this is different than it has been for the last 10 years.â€

Content_title: Rangnick sends Man Utd transfer message to Ten Hag over â€˜new strikersâ€™ and Ronaldo
Contents: Erik ten Hag should look to bring in â€œa couple of new strikersâ€ in the summer transfer window, according to Man Utd interim boss Ralf Rangnick. The Dutchman will take over from Rangnick at the end of the current season with the Red Devils confirming his appointment last week. Ten Hag will have numerous issues to deal with when he takes the reins in the summer with reports all season suggesting unrest in the Man Utd dressing room. Transfer gossip: Man Utd to move for free-agent Dybala while Arsenal target Rashford One of his first jobs will be to find out whether Ronaldo wants to stay another year with reports earlier this year indicating he would attempt to leave if he couldnâ€™t play in the Champions League next season. Man Utd are currently sixth in the Premier League, five points off fourth-placed Arsenal, who have played two fewer games than the Red Devils. Ronaldo scored the equaliser in a 1-1 draw against Chelsea on Thursday night to take his goal tally for the season to 23. When he was asked about Ronaldoâ€™s future after the match, Rangnick replied: â€œThis is something that we should speak about between Erik and the board and myself. Cristiano has another year of contract. â€œIt is also important to find out what he wants, if he wants to stay.â€ ğŸ’¬ Our interim boss was pleased with how we responded after going a goal behind on Thursday â¬‡ï¸#MUFC | #MUNCHE â€” Manchester United (@ManUtd) April 29, 2022 In another interview, Rangnick added: â€œIn the end, itâ€™s both Erikâ€™s and also Crisâ€™s decision what they want to do. â€œIt is not for me to speak about that but, today, the performance of Cris was really great.â€ Bruno Fernandes has scored the next most goals after Ronaldo this season and Rangnick thinks Man Utd need to add two more strikers to their squad in the summer transfer window. Rangnick said: â€œWe have to still be fair with the players. We had quite a few other players scoring goals. â€œI remember, in my first 10 games, we had 10 different goalscorers. It is how many opportunities can we create and how many goalscorers. â€œRight now, we very much rely on Cristiano, he also showed a good performance when Chelsea were in possession. But there has to be a focus on bringing in a couple of new strikers for sure.â€

Content_title: Premier League clubs vote to allow five subs from start of next season
Contents: Premier League clubs have agreed to allow five substitutions from the start of next season following Thursdayâ€™s shareholders meeting. A temporary amendment to the rules had been implemented to increase the number of substitutions from three when football resumed in the summer of 2020 following its mid-season suspension because of the Covid-19 pandemic. The changes were extended last summer by the International Football Association Boardâ€™s advisory panel for a further 18 months before a permanent decision was made in October to keep the option of using five substitutes in place. Liverpool trio among Europeâ€™s top five for most appearancesâ€¦ However, despite clubs across Europe following IFABâ€™s proposal, the Premier League had decided against using the recommendations for the 2020-21 campaign and instead reverted back to three substitutions. Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp and Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola were both critics of not adopting the changes for the current domestic league campaign when it was allowed in European competitions as well as for Englandâ€™s domestic cup fixtures. Premier League Shareholders met today and discussed a range of matters. Clubs agreed to change the rules relating to substitute players. From next season, clubs will be permitted to use five substitutions. Full statement: https://t.co/Ub985Gl3Lj pic.twitter.com/T27WXiXbUM â€” Premier League (@premierleague) March 31, 2022 Previously some top-flight clubs had expressed reservations over a move to permanently increase the number of substitutes available during a league game amid concerns it could favour those with stronger squad depth. Following further discussions on Thursday, it was decided to adopt the new regulations from the start of the 2022-2023 campaign which will be officially implemented at the annual general meeting. The Premier League also confirmed the 2022 summer transfer window will open on June 10 and close at 11pm BST on September 1, which will bring it in line with other European leagues, while Covid-19 protocols will move to symptomatic testing of players and staff rather than twice-weekly.

Content_title: PL and FA flag â€˜integrity issuesâ€™ over Chelsea ticket ban
Contents: The Premier League and the Football Association have raised integrity concerns with the Government over the Chelsea ticket sale ban, the club have said. The Government has placed the club under a special licence after sanctioning owner Roman Abramovich over his ties to Russian president Vladimir Putin. The licence is designed to prevent Chelsea â€“ and by extension Abramovich â€“ generating any new revenue, including from ticket sales. READ MORE: Ten stars who would solve issues if they were ten years younger Chelsea released a statement on Monday afternoon saying they were pressing the Government for the right to sell tickets, and that the club were holding daily meetings to get the licence amended. The club also revealed the Premier League and the FA had raised concerns over the licence, which prevents Chelsea selling new tickets to home areas of the ground, to away supporters visiting Stamford Bridge or to Chelsea fans wishing to watch their team on the road. â€œWe are pressing the Government to allow our supporters to have access to tickets,â€ the club statement said. â€œMeetings are taking place daily in search of a resolution. In addition, the Premier League and FA are also discussing with the Government the sporting integrity issues raised if they do not permit fans to attend. â€œWe are aware of the high level of frustration our supporters are facing over this issue, and we are doing everything we can to resolve it as soon as possible.â€ The licence has already been amended since it was first imposed, with the limit on matchday spending increased from Â£500,000 to Â£900,000, and the club have already insisted they will push to have it further amended in order for them to be able to operate as close to normal as possible. The club said they were awaiting further updates from the Government regarding the sale of further tickets for the FA Cup quarter-final tie at Middlesbrough this weekend. Meanwhile, Chelsea fans have again been urged to stop chanting Abramovichâ€™s name. Prime Minister Boris Johnsonâ€™s official spokesman said it was â€œcompletely inappropriateâ€ to sing in support of the billionaire, who has brought unprecedented success to Chelsea since he bought the club in 2003. Downing Street said supporters should not let that blind them to Abramovichâ€™s association to Putin, the man who ordered the Russian invasion of Ukraine. â€œWe recognise the strength of feeling around peopleâ€™s clubs, but that does not excuse behaviour which is completely inappropriate at this time,â€ the Prime Ministerâ€™s spokesman said. â€œI think people can show passion and support for their club without resorting to that sort of stuff.â€ The Government has said it is still â€œopenâ€ to Chelsea being sold but that a new application would be needed to enable a sale. So far, the spokesman said, the club had not applied for a variation to its strict special licence. â€œWe are open to the sale of the club, we would consider an application for a licence to allow that to happen in the right circumstances,â€ the spokesman said. â€œBut it is for Chelsea to determine the exact process. My understanding is potential buyers would approach the club, who would then need to apply for a further amended licence to facilitate the sale. â€œAs far as Iâ€™m aware that hasnâ€™t happened at this point.â€

Content_title: Emery says Villarreal must try â€˜something no-one has doneâ€™ to beat Liverpool in Champions League
Contents: Villarreal manager Unai Emery admits his side need to play the perfect game if they are to shock Liverpool to reach the clubâ€™s first Champions League final. Trailing 2-0 from a one-sided first leg, the former Arsenal boss was reminded their opponents had lost just three of 57 matches in a quadruple-chasing season. MAILBOX: Liverpool fans are the luckiest in the world, bad for city if Everton go down â€œI didnâ€™t want to hear those details but I did,â€ he said. â€œIt is a difficult task but we are working on the game. â€œWe need to play a perfect game. We need to find our excellence in certain things and maybe achieve something no one has achieved, which is this kind of comeback. â€œWe will try to find some weak spots, something that no one has done this season.â€ Liverpool completely dominated the midfield battle at Anfield last week with Thiago Alcantara, in his best form since joining the club at the start of last season, the man of the match. Emery accepts they cannot allow that to happen again. â€œThey played a tremendous game at Liverpool,â€ he said of the Redsâ€™ midfield. â€œThiago was man of the match, Fabinho has been fantastic at Liverpool. â€œThey are two players who can play really good football but they have the work-rate and intensity and they were at a world-class level at Liverpool (last week). â€œIf the player of the match is again a Liverpool player we will be out for sure but if it is one of ours we can be there.â€ There was some positive news for Emery with striker Gerard Moreno, who missed the first leg, back after injury, although they will be missing former Bournemouth winger Arnaut Danjuma who is ill. â€œGerard trained with the rest of the group today,â€ said the Villarreal boss. â€œI donâ€™t know to what extent he will be fit for contention. We will not take any risks.â€

Content_title: Tottenham told to target â€˜world-classâ€™ ex-Arsenal man â€“ â€˜that level of player is what you wantâ€™

When you hear these demands, stay where you are. Certainly donâ€™t come to a club like PSG, who need to improve their image, one far more healthy. â€œYou need people who are passionate about football, and Iâ€™m not saying Conte isnâ€™t, but he seems more passionate about his chequebook than managing Tottenham, PSG or another team. Thatâ€™s already problematic.â€

Content_title: West Ham boss Moyes insists Arsenal improvements down to lack of European football

Moyes watched his West Ham side fall to a 2-1 defeat to their London rivals on Sunday as they juggle the demands of trying to reach the Europa League final with an overstretched squad. It mathematically ended the Hammersâ€™ pursuit of fourth place and Moyes insists Arsenalâ€™s domestic resurgence after a disappointing 2020-21 campaign is partly a result of their reduced workload. 16 Conclusions: Patched-up and knackered West Ham 1-2 Arsenal set-pieces â€œMy goodness, itâ€™s made a difference for them from day one,â€ Moyes said. â€œArsenalâ€™s improvement this year has been incredible because probably not being involved in Europe has given them the chance to prepare correctly for games. â€œThey had a bit of a slow start to the season, but theyâ€™ve been in terrific form all season. Itâ€™s just as well when you have a young team and are trying to get a good enough squad together. â€œLast season Arsenal got to the semi-finals of the Europa League and it became quite a difficult season for them because of that. Weâ€™re in it this year so weâ€™re a bit the same.â€ ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡· Gabi x Gabi ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡·#WHUARS pic.twitter.com/pq690RT5Cn â€” Arsenal (@Arsenal) May 2, 2022 The defeat at London Stadium confirmed that West Ham can only qualify for the Champions League if they overhaul a 2-1 deficit when they travel to Eintracht Frankfurt for the decisive leg of their semi-final. Content_title: Klopp angered by reporter question, claims Liverpool star â€˜would play in each team in the worldâ€™
Contents: Jurgen Klopp was not happy when asked whether Liverpoolâ€™s job was done ahead of their Champions League semi-final second leg against Villarreal. But we played a good game at home and we need to play a good one away as well. â€œYou never know if weâ€™ll get another chance in a semi-final. â€œWe have an exceptional team but you need luck, so you had better treat it carefully and we will. If Villarreal beats us with a result, congratulations and thatâ€™s it.â€ #UCL focus ğŸ’¯ pic.twitter.com/CY2lc6nwV6 â€” Liverpool FC (@LFC) May 2, 2022 Klopp also stated that Liverpool must play a â€œtop gameâ€ to get the better of Villarreal: â€œMaturity and experience is important but not the only decisive thing. Maturity is important but not the only thing.â€ Klopp went onto claim that in current form Thiago would play in every team in the world: â€œIn the shape he is in now, heâ€™d play in each team in the world and for Spain as well. â€œJust when he got here he was injured and Spain had a lot of options. There should be two or three new strikers next season, itâ€™s pretty obvious.â€ CR7 in front of the Stretford End ğŸ¯ ğŸ‘ @Cristiano #MUFC | #MUNCHE pic.twitter.com/Qrnd0G1hKx â€” Manchester United (@ManUtd) April 28, 2022 On summer recruitment, he added: â€œIf you think of Manchester City and Liverpool, they brought in [players] every transfer window. â€œThey strengthened the team, they brought in players not that popular at the time when they signed and developed into the two best teams in the world. â€œI wouldnâ€™t be surprised if they play in the Champions League final in a few weeks. â€œThis shows it is possible that this can happen and it would not necessarily need three, four years in order to do that.â€ On the appointment of Ten Hag, Rangnick continued: â€œKnowing Erik will be the manager, with a good recruitment process and bringing in the right players, Iâ€™m very positive the supporters and the media will be able to see a better team and, at the end, hopefully a better position in the league. â€œThere are quite a few good examples in the league with when Jurgen Klopp came to Liverpool, Pep Guardiola to Manchester City, Thomas Tuchel came to Chelsea â€“ yes, he came in the middle of the season and inherited a top-quality squad, but you still need to win the Champions League. â€œIf you know what youâ€™re looking for, the profiles of the different positions you need, it shouldnâ€™t hopefully take too long.â€

Content_title: Agent of â‚¬70m-rated star rubbishes â€˜fake newsâ€™ claiming player favours move to Man Utd
